questions.question: Who wrote the letter?

options.text: The ninth of June two thousand and fifteen

questions.answer: The ninth of June two thousand and fifteen

questions.question: What is the ordinal number for '1'?
What is the ordinal number for '12'?
Which sign-off is appropriate for a letter to a boss?
How should Kimaya begin a letter to her younger brother?
Which of these is a non-English word used in the letter?
What is the ordinal number for '20'?
Which magazine was NOT mentioned in Kaka-ajoba's library?
What kind of language can you use with close relatives and friends?
What is the ordinal number for '8'?
Which of these relatives lives at Sagroli?
What smaller word is hidden in 'reached'?
How should Raman pronounce non-English words like 'Aamras'?
Who is the sender of the letter?
questions.answer: Raman is the sender of the letter[cite: 13].

questions.question: To whom is the letter addressed?
questions.answer: The letter is addressed to Sanjumama[cite: 3].

questions.question: Where does Sanjumama live?
Where does Raman live?
What is the name of the river at Sagroli?
questions.answer: The river at Sagroli is named Manjara[cite: 7].

questions.question: Who has a library in Sagroli?
questions.answer: Kaka-ajoba has a library in Sagroli[cite: 10].

questions.question: List three magazines Raman enjoyed reading.
questions.answer: Raman enjoyed reading Kishor, Champak, and Kumar[cite: 10].

questions.question: What did Raman do on the banks of the Manjara river?
questions.answer: Raman played with Tejas and Avadhoot on the river banks[cite: 7].

questions.question: What activity made Raman feel like the 'King of Sagroli'?
questions.answer: Riding a buffalo on the way back home made him feel like the King of Sagroli[cite: 8].

questions.question: Who are Tejas and Avadhoot?
questions.answer: Tejas and Avadhoot are Raman's young relatives/friends at Sagroli[cite: 7, 12].

questions.question: Name the female relatives mentioned in the letter.
questions.answer: The female relatives mentioned are Ajji, Shailamami, and Meeramami[cite: 12].

questions.question: Name the male relatives mentioned in the letter.
questions.answer: The male relatives mentioned are Sanjumama, Ajoba, Rajumama, Kaka-ajoba, Tejas, and Avadhoot[cite: 10, 12].

questions.question: What are 'Kurdai' and 'Papdya'?
questions.answer: They are traditional side dishes/snacks mentioned as part of the lunch[cite: 9].

questions.question: What does Raman miss about Sagroli?
questions.answer: Raman misses the wonderful days, swimming, long walks, the library, and the delicious food[cite: 6, 7, 9, 10].

questions.question: How does Raman sign off his letter?
questions.answer: He signs off with 'Yours lovingly, Raman'[cite: 13].

questions.question: What is the P.S. (Post Script) in the letter?
questions.answer: The P.S. mentions sending postal stamps for Tejas and a match-box cover for Avadhoot[cite: 14].

questions.question: When does Raman plan to visit Sagroli again?
questions.answer: Raman is looking forward to visiting Sagroli next year[cite: 11].

questions.question: How would you read '26 January' aloud?
questions.answer: It is read as 'The twenty-sixth of January'[cite: 35, 36].

questions.question: What is the ordinal number for 100?
Give an example of a 'last line' for a formal letter to a boss.
questions.answer: An appropriate last line would be 'Thank you' or 'Regards'[cite: 47].

questions.question: How should Kimaya address her bank manager?
questions.answer: She should begin with 'To, The Manager, Bank of People...'[cite: 47].

questions.question: What sign-off should be used for a friend?
questions.answer: A sign-off like 'Yours,' or 'See you soon!' is appropriate for a friend[cite: 47].

questions.question: What hidden words can be found in 'wonderful'?
questions.answer: Words like 'won', 'on', and 'under' can be found in 'wonderful'[cite: 33].

questions.question: What hidden words can be found in 'incomparable'?
List two non-English food items from the letter.
questions.answer: Two food items are Aamras and Kanda bhaji[cite: 9].

questions.question: Why does Raman call Meeramami a 'master chef'?
questions.answer: He calls her a master chef because she is a great cook and the lunch she prepared was wonderful[cite: 9].

questions.question: How should '15 August' be read?
questions.answer: It is read as 'The fifteenth of August'[cite: 35, 39].

questions.question: What is the ordinal form of '3'?
What is the ordinal form of '5'?
What is the ordinal form of '9'?
What is the ordinal form of '11'?
What is the ordinal form of '13'?
What is the ordinal form of '15'?
Which relative's shrikhanda wadi is mentioned as incomparable?
questions.answer: Ajji's shrikhanda wadi is mentioned as incomparable[cite: 10].

questions.question: What does Raman say about his summer vacation?
questions.answer: He says it added many colourful and unforgettable memories to his life[cite: 5, 6].

questions.question: How should Kimaya sign a letter to her father?
questions.answer: She should sign it as 'Your loving daughter'[cite: 47].

questions.question: How should Kimaya sign a letter to Mrs. Bendre?
questions.answer: She should sign it with 'Yours sincerely'[cite: 47].

questions.question: What kind of expressions should be used when writing to bank managers or bosses?
questions.answer: Typical polite and formal expressions should be used[cite: 49, 50].

questions.question: Identify an exclamation from the letter.
Identify another exclamation from the letter regarding food.
Identify an exclamation Raman uses to describe Meeramami.
questions.answer: He uses the exclamation 'A master chef!'[cite: 9].

questions.question: Identify an exclamation Raman uses about Ajji's sweet.
questions.answer: He says, 'Ajjiâ€™s shrikhanda wadi is incomparable!'[cite: 10].

questions.question: What is a 'bound volume'?
questions.answer: A bound volume is a collection of magazine issues fastened together in a single book[cite: 10].

questions.question: Who are Kimaya's relatives mentioned in exercise 7?
questions.answer: The relatives mentioned are her father and her younger brother Bittoo[cite: 47].

questions.question: Which non-English word refers to a paternal/maternal grandfather in Marathi/Hindi?
questions.answer: The word 'Ajoba' is used for grandfather[cite: 10, 12].

questions.question: Which non-English word refers to a paternal/maternal grandmother?
questions.answer: The word 'Ajji' is used for grandmother[cite: 10, 12].

questions.question: Which non-English word refers to a maternal uncle?
questions.answer: The word 'Mama' (as in Sanjumama or Rajumama) is used[cite: 3, 12].

questions.question: Which non-English word refers to the wife of a maternal uncle?
questions.answer: The word 'Mami' (as in Shailamami or Meeramami) is used[cite: 9, 12].
